segments.text: What a mess in this kitchen— the sink is overflowing like crazy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That woman is just standing there, drying a stupid plate, ignoring it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's ruining the cabinets and floor, and she doesn't even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's probably soaked now, serves her right for being so clueless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden looks perfect, mocking this indoor sloppiness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now those kids— the boy's on a stool that's about to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's raiding the cookie jar like it's his personal stash.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's helping him, hand out like she deserves a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They shouldn't be climbing like that; it's reckless and annoying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stacked dishes could crash if the stool tips— more chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cabinets make it even worse, everything exposed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand how no one's fixing this nonsense.
segments.speaker: PAR
